intro: Paraphlomis gracilis, commonly known as slender cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Paraphlomis gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
